title: Tile Panel (Spain), early 18th century
medium: light buff earthenware, polychrome underglaze painting, cement
creditline: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
description: Six square and three rectangular tiles, set in cement. St. Ignatius of Loyola, founder of the Jesuits, kneeling on globe, set aflame by lightning emanating from his raised right hand; in sky, halo-encircled IHS; attended by four female figures, allegories of the Four Continents, and their animals; cockatoo, alligator, horse and camel. Inscription: Et quid volo nisi ut accendayur/ accendetur velut ignis zelus tuu. ps 70. (thy zeal be kindled like a fire?)

tombstone.epitaph: Tile Panel (Spain), early 18th century; light buff earthenware, polychrome underglaze painting, cement; H x W x D (Framed(?)): 71.4 × 57.2 × 7.6 cm, 27.2 kg (28 1/8 × 22 1/2 × 3 in., 60 lb.); Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960-1-74
